EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone)
Consists of:
• A boiler positioned at (8.0, 20.5) that provides steam via its output at (6.5, 20.5) and features connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5). Its fluid system identifier has been updated through successive steps (most recently seen as 56875).  
• Multiple steam engines installed at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5).  
• An extra steam engine remains unplaced due to spatial congestion within the boiler zone.

### Automated Mining Setup
Consists of:
• A burner mining drill located at (–15.0, –50.0) dedicated to resource extraction.  
• Burner inserters positioned at (–14.5, –52.5) and (–13.5, –52.5) (with an additional unit at approximately (–16.5, –48.5)) to assist in transferring mined resources.  
• A wooden chest placed at (–13.5, –51.5) that acts as temporary storage.

### Smelting Process Cluster
Consists of:
• Stone furnaces located at (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0) used to convert raw ores into plates.  
• Associated burner inserters and wooden chests configured to support the smelting workflow.

### Fluid and Electrical Infrastructure
Consists of:
• An offshore pump at (0.5, 30.5) delivering water to the network.  
• Multiple pipe groups that form an extensive fluid distribution network (with fluid system IDs evolving over recent steps).  
• Electricity groups interlinking dispersed power poles and belt groups that connect various production and processing sectors.

### Research Lab Network
Consists of:
• Lab units configured for automation research and processing science packs.  
• Laboratory components (each with a unique electrical identifier that has been updated in recent steps, e.g. 14229 and 14255) that continue to experience power connectivity issues.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue:
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to severe spatial congestion in the boiler zone around (8.0, 20.5), compounded by overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts near the (8.5, 22.5) connection point.
  – To mitigate, manually remove or reposition interfering entities, redesign the adjacent connection interfaces to enlarge the buildable area, or relocate the extra steam engine to a less congested area.

• Steam Engine Network Connection Warnings:
  – Multiple steam engines report disconnection from the power network and deficiencies in fluid input.
  – Verify proper alignment of connection points between the boiler’s steam output and each engine, and ensure that both electrical and fluid piping are correctly integrated to avoid missing inputs.

• Research Lab Power Connectivity Issue:
  – Lab units continue to show a NO_POWER status despite repeated diagnostics.
  – Reassess and reconfigure the electrical network layout so that lab components are effectively integrated into the primary power grid, with well–aligned power poles and accurate electrical group identifiers.
